requirement_designation: Humanities and Arts with Race & Ethnicity(*)
class_notes:
(Same as AAS 262 1)
(This course provides a survey of African American literature from roughly 1900 to the present and will acquaint students with key figures and issues within African American literary studies. We will cover major cultural movements and periods, including the New Negro Renaissance, the Chicago Renaissance, and the Black Arts Movement, and students will engage literature and literary analysis as tools of social protest and critique.)
course_description: An overview of African-American literature since 1900. Students will read and examine writings by major contributors to each period in the genres of fiction (short story and novel) essay, poetry, and narratives of enslavement. Students will write and revise four five-page critical essays.
